column4: someone help me please I've been in computer hell for a week!
I installed ubuntu and it took over my entire 2tb drive
windows will not format it back to ntfs
I used disk utility to format to ntfs and windows still won't install on it
you can use the liveCD to resize the Ubuntu partition and make room for the Windows install
you will need to boot to liveCD after the install as Windows will blindly overwite the MBR with its own thing
is LiveCD going to be different than the disk utility in ubuntu?
the disk utility will be used, you need the liveCD as you cannot resize mounted partitions
alternatively you can use the Windows installer or liveCD to delete all partitions then install Windows to a portion of the space, then install Ubuntu to the free space
what activities do you do on the remote system?
what OS is the system you are connecting to?
strange, so you run photoshop on Linux then VNC to use it on a Mac....
why not run photoshop on the mac?
could try X forwarding via SSH, it's all I can suggest. Let me see how to make vnc faster, its a horribly old protocol
